20000 Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Jan Fcb Mar Apr May Jun
To perform relative strength analysis, an analyst calculates the ratios of an asset’s closing
prices to benchmark values, such as a stock index or comparable asset, and draws a
line chart of the ratios. An increasing trend indicates that the asset is outperforming
the benchmark (positive relative strength) and a decrease shows that the asset is
underperforming the benchmark (negative relative strength).
